title: Parser can't handle big tables?
body:
## Description of the bug
I was trying to apply `Fonduer` on a few `html` files converted from `xlsx` sheets. During the parsing phase, while most of them worked fine, one of the files can't be successfully parsed, in a way that no error message was printed, but the resulting database was empty.

One noticeable difference of this specific file is its size. The original sheet is a 700+ by 50+ table, the converted html file is 16MB, which are significant bigger than the others. After exploring for a while, I might suspect the parser doesn't handle large tables very well. By any chance do you have any experience on this type of issue? Thank you!

P.S. As part of the inspection, I tripled the data volume (simple repetition of the rows for three time) of a smaller file to make the size comparable with the file of issue. Nothing was returned again, however, the parsing on the smaller file itself is good.

## To Reproduce
Since the data is confidential, I can't upload here. But I may be able to create some fake data if needed.

## Expected behavior
The `apply` method of `parser` failed when the original worksheet is bigger(?), without prompting error messages.

## Error Logs/Screenshots
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/49058444/103314768-c7df5d00-49d8-11eb-83ee-8393a6d35de0.png)

## Environment (please complete the following information)
 - PostgreSQL Version: 13.1
 - Fonduer Version: 0.8.2
